title: Venice (California)
name: Abbot Kinney
content: The Abbot Kinney district (the area along Abbot Kinney Boulevard) runs for about 1.5 miles between Main St. and Washington Blvd.  The area is a hotspot for artists and hipsters and includes numerous shops, restaurants and bars including several excellent art galleries, about a half-dozen interesting clothing boutiques and over a dozen cafes and eateries.  Named for the developer who originally created the "Venice of America", the area holds an annual festival featuring music and art.
